labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides tools for generating images from text prompts using advanced AI models. Its core functionality revolves around creating visual content based on user specifications, which is highly useful for artists, designers, and anyone needing customized imagery. The available tool, generate_image, allows users to produce high-quality visuals by simple text input.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen as "Content Creation" since the server's main function is generating visual content, which aligns well with writing, editing, and media generation. The secondary label of "AI/ML Tools" is added because the server leverages AI models to accomplish its tasks. There is no need for a custom label as the predefined ones adequately cover its functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Image Generator

server_info_crawled.overview: Generate images from text prompts effortlessly. Utilize advanced AI models to create stunning visuals tailored to your specifications. Perfect for artists, designers, and anyone in need of custom imagery.

tools.name: generate_image
tools.description: Deploy Server Image Generator @GMKR/imagegenerator Try in Playground generate_image

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "provider": "replicate"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@GMKR/imagegenerator/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
